paper_abstract: An efficient time-accurate algorithm is presented for numerical simulations of low-Mach number variable density flows in the context of non-premixed flames. The algorithm is based on a segregated solution formalism in the class of pressure-correction methods. It shows good conservation properties and returns stable results, regardless of the difference in density between neighboring cells. A simplified Burke-Schumann flame model is used to describe the heat release due to mixing of fuel and oxidizer. The convergence rate of the method is discussed for a 1D channel flow, containing fuel and oxidizer. Copyright (c) 2008 John Wiley & Sons, Ltd.
paper_title: A stable pressure-correction scheme for variable density flows involving non-premixed combustion
